unit_learning_outcomes.description: Apply knowledge in research methods to analyse, interpret and assess research findings
Critically appraise research literature on a specific clinically relevant topic and identify areas requiring further research
Demonstrate knowledge of research methods by either designing a research protocol, or implementing a research project, to answer a specific research question in a clinically relevant area
Effectively communicate the design of a research protocol, or results of a research project, to your peers and academics using verbal and written methods

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Research proposal/project development - Collaborative group work

assessments.description: Multiple choice questions that evaluate student learning of lecture material. The assessment will be held in the scheduled lecture time.
In the tutorial class time, students will give an individual oral research presentation about their group research protocol, or about the results of their group research project.
The student research protocol, or research project, will be written up in the format of a journal article (approximately 2,000 words), ready for submission for publication in a peer reviewed journal.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 2, Special circumstances
data.description: This unit, together with CHIR8201, develops a student's ability to critique, evaluate and synthesise biomedical research. These skills are crucial for life-long learning and are essential in evidence-informed clinical practice. In this unit, students will work in groups to develop and execute a medium term, capstone research project to answer a specific research question/s.
data.title: Postgraduate Advanced Research II

description: This unit, together with CHIR8201, develops a student's ability to critique, evaluate and synthesise biomedical research. title: Postgraduate Advanced Research II
